elements.title: Luca Salsi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Luca Salsi (pictured) performed leading roles in two operas in a row at the Metropolitan Opera, stepping in on 30 minutes' notice in Verdi's Ernani and singing as planned in Lucia di Lammermoor?

elements.title: My Personal Weatherman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Japanese actor Kouhei Higuchi prepared for his role on the television drama adaptation of My Personal Weatherman by learning from a weather forecaster?

elements.title: Erin Swenson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Erin Swenson was the first mainstream Protestant minister known to have undergone gender transition while in ordained office?

elements.title: an ancient wildcat species (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an ancient wildcat species is known only from a part of the jaw of a single animal discovered in Poland?

elements.title: Leo Bagrow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when historian of cartography Leo Bagrow was granted Swedish citizenship in 1952, he had been stateless for 34 years?

elements.title: akazehe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that rural women in Burundi greet each other with an intricate musical ritual called akazehe?

elements.title: Margarita Ortega (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Margarita Ortega left her husband to fight in the Mexican Revolution?

elements.title: Picklesburgh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the "Mayor of Picklesburgh" is decided by a pickle juice drinking competition?
